page.title: 08ENTERTAINMENTS:FENNY COMPTON
page.content: {'PUBLIC ENTERTAINMENTS'}are held in the Village Hall ( dances,Whist Drives or Concerts)the School(Concerts,plays, May Day,Sports,Family Evenings)or the Bowling Green Pavilion(Whist Drives) On Nov.5th.the School organises a Bonfire Party with firework displays,& hot food - sausages,soup,coffee - and Christmas plays & entertainments for all.{PRIVATE ENTERTAINMENT }consists largely of television/video within the home,while the young enjoy computer games.Most homes have Music Centres,& tape decks;very few play their own musical instruments.The nearest cinema is in Banbury,theatre in Coventry,tho' few people go to either.Annually,there is a boat race for charity on the canal,& some motorcycle events on the hills.Sometimes there are Street Parties to celebrate with music & dancing some special national event.
